other_tests.findings: Detection of a missense mutation (C189R) on the maternal DUOXA2 allele and a large deletion comprising DUOX2, DUOXA2, and DUOXA1.
Positive result for congenital hypothyroidism (TSH, 58 mU/liter).
High serum TSH level of 151 mU/liter and slightly low total T4 of 5.2 Âµg/dl.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent treatment with L-T4 reduced serum TSH to 7.0 mU/liter within 1 week.

other_tests.findings: After 1 month of L-T4 withdrawal, serum TSH rose to 5.3 mU/liter, but serum free T4 concentration was within the reference range.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient maintained normal growth and remained clinically euthyroid with TSH levels of 4.2, 3.2, and 3.4 mU/liter over 12 months.
